ncmw.setup_models package¶

Submodules¶

ncmw.setup_models.setup module¶

ncmw.setup_models.setup.create_consistent_model(model: cobra.core.model.Model) → Tuple[cobra.core.model.Model, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame][source]¶

This will create a more consistent model, using fastcc (https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1003424) and also returns a summary report with the improvments.

Args:

model (cobra.core.Model): Cobra metabolic model class verbose (bool, optional): Print out results in console . Defaults to True.

Returns:

cobra.core.Model: Returns a more consistent cobra model. pd.DataFrame: Returns some statistics that may be imprved.

ncmw.setup_models.setup.fastcc(model: cobra.core.model.Model) → cobra.core.model.Model[source]¶

FastCC algorithm to increase model quality by resolving conflicts and removing unnecessary e.g. blocked pathways https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1003424

Returns

Returns a more consistent cobra model.

Return type

cobra.core.Model

ncmw.setup_models.setup.gapfill_medium(model: cobra.core.model.Model, eps: float = 0.1) → Tuple[cobra.core.model.Model, List][source]¶

This will add the minimal set of exchange reactions such that the model has more than eps growth.

Parameters

  • model (Model) – Cobra model which has less than eps growth

  • eps (float, optional) – Value for which we consider the model to have zero growth . Defaults to 1e-6.

Returns

Cobra model with extended medium list: List of extended metabolites

Return type

Model

ncmw.setup_models.setup.gapfill_model(model: cobra.core.model.Model, eps: float = 1e-06, fill_model_base: str = 'base', **kwargs)[source]¶

Adds reactions to the model, such that it has growth in the given medium

Parameters

  • model (Model) – Cobra model

  • eps ([type], optional) – Minimum growth value. Defaults to 1e-6.

  • fill_model_base (str, optional) – The base set of reactions to consider .

  • to "ecoli". (Defaults) –

  • kwargs (dict, optional) – Additional kwargs for cobra gapfilling, seed pycobra

  • https (documentation) – //cobrapy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gapfilling.html

Returns

Cobra model that has growth if algorithm succeeds list: List of reactions that were added

Return type

Model

ncmw.setup_models.setup.score_memote(model_path: str, report_path: str, solver_timout: int = 120) → None[source]¶

Generates a memote evaluation report for the model quality.

NOTE: This typically requires a rather consistent model, otherwise it breaks. NOTE: This can take a while on a local computer, especially if the solver_timeout is high

Parameters

  • str – Path to the model file: Typically SBML format

  • str – Path to the model file: Typically SBML format

  • int – Time in seconds until the solver timeouts.

This

Parameters

  • model (Model) – A cobra model

  • configs (str) – File name of a config file in json format

  • medium (str) – File name of a medium file in json format

Returns

Cobra model
